intro: Nicolsonia reptans, commonly known as the creeping nicolsonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often lie close to the ground. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, with a slightly peppery scent. Nicolsonia reptans is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
